text:
The most widely used reference rate for floating-rate bonds is the London Interbank
Offer Rate (Libor), although other reference rates, such as Euribor, are also used. Libor
rates are published daily for several currencies and for maturities of one day (overnight
rates) to one year. Thus, there is no single “Libor rate” but rather a set of rates, such as
“30-day U.S. dollar Libor” or “90-day Swiss franc Libor.”
